Legal_Issue: Whether the Review Tribunal erred in denying the request to re-open the decision under s. 84(2) of the Canada Pension Plan
Evidence_Assessment: Medical reports post-dating original decision; deemed speculative by Tribunal but found material by court
Decision_Outcome: Denial of disability pension benefits initially; request to re-open denied by Tribunal
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show new, material, and previously undiscoverable facts
Credibility_Factor: Dr. Zoffmann's report linking depression to past accidents considered credible and material by court
Legal_Rule: A decision may be rescinded or amended under s. 84(2) CPP if new facts are material and not discoverable with due diligence
Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly consider new evidence in reopening application
Grounds_for_Claim: New medical evidence showing link between depression and past accidents
Outcome_on_Merits: Original denial upheld pending reassessment; case remanded
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Tribunal's refusal to reopen decision found patently unreasonable
Legal_Framework: Canada Pension Plan, Federal Courts Act
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of request to re-open decision based on new evidence
Court_Result: Judicial review granted; matter remanded for reassessment by different panel
Standard_of_Proof: Materiality and lack of discoverability with due diligence
Defendant_Response: Tribunal maintained original decision, deeming new evidence immaterial and speculative
Remedy_Requested: Reopening of decision and reassessment of disability claim
Authority: Canada Pension Plan Review Tribunal, Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: New evidence not sufficiently material or discoverable
Applicable_Process: Application for reopening under s. 84(2), followed by judicial review
Outcome_of_Review: Successful judicial review; case sent back for reconsideration
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Request to re-open decision and grant disability benefits
